On this page

Checkbox Component ​

Multiple selection among a set of options.

Basic Usage ​

Can be used alone to toggle between two states

The selected state is bound to the variable in v-model. Its value is Boolean type.
vue
<template>
  <ImCheckbox v-model="checked" label="Hello China" />
</template>
1
2
3

Disabled State ​

Set the disabled property to true to make the checkbox unavailable.

vue
<template>
  <ImCheckbox label="Hello China" disabled />
</template>
1
2
3

Readonly State ​

Set the readonly property to true to make the checkbox read-only.

vue
<template>
  <ImCheckbox label="Hello China" readonly />
</template>
1
2
3

Checkbox Group ​

In multiple selection mode, each ImCheckbox must have a value property, and v-model must be an array.
All selected: []
vue
<template>
  <ImCheckbox
    v-model="isCheckAll"
    :indeterminate="indeterminate"
    label="Select All"
    @change="onCheckAll" />
  <div>{{ checkedList }}</div>
  <ImCheckbox
    :value="item"
    v-model="checkedList"
    @change="onItemChange"
    v-for="item in list"
    >Option {{ item }}</ImCheckbox
  >
</template>
<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';

const checkedList = ref([]);
const isCheckAll = ref(false);
const indeterminate = computed(
  () =>
    checkedList.value.length > 0 &&
    list.length > checkedList.value.length &&
    !isCheckAll.value
);
const list = ['1', '2', '3'];

watch(
  () => checkedList.value,
  (val) => {
    isCheckAll.value = val.length === list.length;
  }
);
const onCheckAll = () => {
  if (isCheckAll.value) {
    checkedList.value = list;
  } else {
    checkedList.value = [];
  }
};
</script>

APIs ​

PropertyDescriptionTypeDefault
v-modelBound valueBooleanfalse
labelDisplay textStringNone
disabledWhether disabledBooleanfalse
readonlyWhether read-onlyBooleanfalse
indeterminateIndeterminate stateBooleanfalse
changeCallback when state changesFunctionNone
nameNative name attributeStringNone
valueBound valueString|NumberNone
